title: who are the gayest champions?

replies.body: {{champion:119}} is gay for {{champion:119}}

Why does sexual orientation even matter here?  Stating it outright doesn't spice things up, and the champions are written as if they were people, so I really don't see why this conversation is even needed.
Because it adds depth to their character and can make them more realistic/relatable and discussing the loluniverse helps expand it.
All you're trying to do is check a box here, and that doesn't make them more realistic or add any depth to who they are.  What are you really asking this for?

the lack of clarity on sexual orientation helps to promote a culture that fosters shame surrounding what is considered nonstandard. Having a definite "check [in] a box" would help to work against that. Granted varus did go a long way towards that but did end up falling short considering the gays in the story had their love portrayed as their greatest weakness and their ultimate downfall for which they were trapped indefinitely in a hellish prison as an evil godwarrior mutilates their flesh into a body for himself and subjects them to psychological torture while slaughtering innocents. TLDR it does add depth and that depth provides important representation for some fans.

No, it doesn't.  The people who promote a culture of shame would do so with or without this box checked.  Leaving orientation unclear does not promote it by itself.

Representation is a different beast, and not everyone requires a character to be "like them".  I honestly feel bad for people who need something like that, because exploring characters that are "not like you" can have far more meaning when done right.

I'm not saying these boxes shouldn't be checked, but you're asking for it to be done in the wrong way.  Riot could just go through and list it for every single champion, but that would be terrible.  What we need are stories that show who these characters are, and if their orientation is important to who they are it will make a natural appearance.  If it's not important to who they are maybe it should stay unclear, at least until a story requires it.

I appreciate Ekko and Lucian so much more. It plays into their characters because Ekko gets this down on his luck inner city kid feel, he reminds me of growing up in Chicago. Lucien plays into that Denzel Washington "man on fire" vibe, man on a mission, Nick Fury badass mofo. These character almost HAVE to be black to sell that characterization and that's why I identify with them.

I can't give Riot brownie points for{{champion:43}} {{champion:555}} so much. I'd like to think that if I was gay I wouldn't do the same for {{champion:110}} 

I feel like I also have to clarify that I 100% do not care about the race or gender or sexual orientation of any champion. I just think that representation in it's current form is stupid and gives Riot just a box to check so that we can have a good black to white gay to straight ratio, instead of actually exploring interesting characters. Fuck that.

You miss the point Ionia is not Asia of our world. Neither Shurima is Middle-East. Valoran is not Europe.

Karma is a black in Ionia for the same reason Irelia and Valmar are whites in Ionia. It is not Asia of our world. Sivir is white too in Shurima.

And where did islanders come from do you think? Islanders have black ethnicity.

I agree it limits interesting characters but black, white, straight, gay, lesbian, trans whatever can be interesting if it is done correctly. If it comes natural, it improves the story.
